title: Are the English more racist than the Scottish, Welsh and Irish? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. None of those nations are more racist than the others to any significant degree. I wrote a similar answer here regarding England and Wales (whose stats were collected together) and Scotland, which showed that racist hate crime statistics were roughly the same in 2015–16 taking into the demographics of each England and Wales and Scotland. I don’t have any stats for Ireland, but I dare say that such figures will be much different from what you will find in Great Britain. Jack Noone's answer to Is it weird or offensive to be English and hate and renounce your own to be fully Scottish? The aftermath of the EU referendum did see a spike in reported hate crimes in England and Wales, which reduced in later months. How much of this was because there were actually more racist incidents and how much was simply because people would be more inclined to report any incidents is unclear however.

I would say no, they are just racist against a different group of people. I have Scottish friends, and as a Scot I would have, who cannot find a good thing to say about the English. For them The health system, education system, football team and everything else is better if Scotland. In some cases they are right, but not all. This is also a form of racism. In other ways, for instance tolerance of people from other cultures, I find Scots more tolerant than many areas of England. In say many areas because London, Manchester and other metropolitan areas are at least equally tolerant. It really depends how you describe racism and how you count the numbers.

What’s that supposed to mean? I’m sick of these insults about predominantly white countries being racist. England has a pretty diverse population and we get along fairly well - sure there are extremists, but the vast majority of people will treat others they meet respectfully and without prejudice. England by far has a more diverse population than Scotland, Wales or Ireland, it would not be valid to compare the level of racism say of London with an island of the coast of Scotland.

I wouldn’t think so. The Scots seem to be more liberal but that’s mostly the younger generation. The English racist thing is just because the English massively outnumber the other three and therefore there is likely a higher proportion of racists. I can’t speak for Scottish Gaelic and Irish but in Welsh, the English are often refered to as “Sais”, usually derogatory followed or preceded by an expletive e.g Bastad Sais - English Bastard

Generally we should avoid generalisations, Sean. As a French friend said once “il y a des cons partout,” and I agree. That said, I would suggest a sizeable portion of the 52% who voted for Brexit would have racist sympathies to a greater or lesser extent, more so than in Scotland or Ireland.
